page.title: 09Westland Engineers,Yeovil.
page.content: The company,who make up & over garage doors,has just moved into spacious new premises. 250 people work there,mostly un- skilled men.They normally work from 7.30 am till 4.30 pm with an hour for dinner,but on the day we went they had started at 6.00 am,preferring to do overtime at the start of the day.Most workers wore gloves because the metal sheets had very sharp edges. Up to 80 different designs & sizes of doors are made.The steel used comes from the British Steel Corpn, either in big rolls or packs of 100 sheets. First it is cut to size on guillotines,then pressed into shape. All the pieces are clamped together & spot-welded,then the door is painted with blue undercoat.They are sent all over Britain
